docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: TODAY is the 20th anniversary of Earth Day. As I write this - some days before the event - I am 3,000 miles from home and traveling alone, a circumstance that provokes contemplation. I've been thinking about where I've been in the last 20 years - between the two Earth Days - and what traveling has taught me about the world that books and lectures and museums devoted to the environment have not.

byline.original: By SUZANNE WINCKLER; SUZANNE WINCKLER is the author of the Great Lakes and Plains States volumes of ''The Smithsonian Guide to Historic America'' (Stewart Tabori & Chang)
